name: long liner maintenance, steel | long liner maintenance, steel | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21522/documentation

This dataset represents the maintenance of steel trawlers, per 1000 kg of light ship weight, based on data from a Spanish fishing fleet operating in European waters (2009), corresponding to 12 vessels (from a fleet of 49) for which data was available with different levels of detail. Specific data for specific inventory items may be based on sub-samples for which detailed data was available. Vessel dimensions: 28 - 38 m length.;System boundaries and relation between activities

Maintenance of vessels, including provision of all materials and work

End of life of replaced materials. Batteries are excluded, as they do not exist in the database. Long lining gear was excluded due to the minimal contribution in total vessel weight.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from Spanish vessels operating in European waters, extrapolated to global (GLO)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Spain, especially the northern regions of Galicia and the Basque Country has various shipyards and relevant ship-building and ship-retrofitting expertise.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Valid for other long lining fisheries with vessel sizes ranging from 25-40 m.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: A sample of 12 vessels of a population of 49 was modelled.

exchanges.description: Maintenance of a steel long liner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW) over its lifetime. Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW,  adjusted for long liner's gear. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication.
